generif.text: Insulin-like growth factor-binding protein 5 (IGFBP-5) interacts with a four and a half LIM protein 2 (FHL2).

-FHL2 interaction may be involved in transcriptional regulation and play a significant role in cancer cell growth

Data indicate that overexpression of the transcriptional cofactor FHL2 contributes to breast cancer development by mediating transcriptional activation of MAPK target genes known to be involved in cancer progression, such as p21.
These results suggest a novel indirect mechanism of androgen action on FHL2 expression and provide evidence that SRF is an important determinant of AR action in prostate cancer cells.

Data suggest Fhl1 (four-and-a-half LIM domains protein 1) and FHL2 (four-and-a-half LIM domains protein 2) bind to and regulate activity of Prkd1 (protein kinase D 1) in cardiac/ventricular myocytes; knockdown of FHL2 down-regulates Prkd1 activation.
FHL2 downregulation has a role in the pathogenesis of myeloid malignancies.
FHL2 is a transcriptional coactivator of LXRs and may be an important determinant of cholesterol metabolism in SMCs

These results identify FHL2 as a novel gene associated with asthma severity in human.

FHL2 facilitates ovarian granulosa cell tumor progression via controlling AKT1 transcription.
FHL2 phosphorylation by FAK is a critical, mechanically dependent step in signaling from soft matrices to the nucleus to inhibit cell proliferation by increasing p21 expression.

FHL2 interacts with ADAM-17 in normal, dysplastic and malignant colon epithelial cells. Colocalisation of these proteins is more frequent in malignant than in normal and dysplastic cells, suggesting a role for ADAM-17/FHL2 complex in the development of colorectal cancer.

FHL2 Inhibits SARS-CoV-2 Replication by Enhancing IFN-beta Expression through Regulating IRF-3.

name: four and a half LIM domains 2

biocarta.name: hypoxia and p53 in the cardiovascular system

pid.name: Signaling events mediated by HDAC Class III

reactome.name: Regulation of lipid metabolism by PPARalpha

summary: This gene encodes a member of the four-and-a-half-LIM-only protein family. Family members contain two highly conserved, tandemly arranged, zinc finger domains with four highly conserved cysteines binding a zinc atom in each zinc finger. This protein is thought to have a role in the assembly of extracellular membranes. Also, this gene is down-regulated during transformation of normal myoblasts to rhabdomyosarcoma cells and the encoded protein may function as a link between presenilin-2 and an intracellular signaling pathway. Multiple alternatively spliced variants encoding different isoforms have been identified. [provided by RefSeq, Jan 2016].
